intro: Bouvardia myrtifolia, commonly known as the pink bouvardia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Bouvardia myrtifolia thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for garden borders and container planting.
